column1: *'''Comments:''' Tolkien appears to have met the couple on a holiday with his wife in 1963.<ref name=Telegraph/>
*'''Description:''' Handwritten letter signed by J.R.R. Tolkien.
It describes a holiday Tolkien and his wife took in 1963
column2: although not a happy one he talks about his delight at meeting the couple
column3: who he addresses "My Dear People". Tolkien goes on to describe his and his wife's health
column4: a 'disastrous holiday' and to thank the recipients for their 'company and kindness'. Accompanying the letter is a Christmas card with photograph of Tolkien flanked by his holiday companions

column1: I meant to send this letter to welcome you home, writes the Hobbit author. "But both of us have been feeling ill.

column2: but I am afraid Edith is not - a v. nasty throat.
and hoped your journey home would be less unpleasant than our icy winds and snow have foreboded.

column1: Rather a disastrous and costly 'holiday'? But for us it was at any rate made memorable by your company and kindness. Love to you both
